newsitem.title: UK: Public will be outraged by UK water profits-Brown.
newsitem.headline: Public will be outraged by UK water profits-Brown.

text.p: Opposition Labour Party economics spokesman Gordon Brown said on Monday that British people would be "outraged" at profits being reported by privatised water companies.
Speaking at a news conference, Brown said; "They would regard a government that failed to deal with this problem as a government that had failed."
Brown had been asked about media reports that the water companies are about to report profits up by some 50 percent in real terms.

He said that the cumulative profit of the water companies since privatisation now totalled some 13 billion sterling yet the firms had failed to tackle leakage problems and in some cases had paid virtually no tax.
Brown confirmed that his proposed windfall tax on the privatised utilities would "comfortably finance" his three billion sterling plan to help the young unemployed back into work."
